questions.question: Use of reverse thrust below the recommended speed may cause:
options: a. over stressing of the gear oleos.
b. ingestion of the exhaust gases and foreign objects.
c. more fuel to be provided to the burners.
d. the TGT limit to be exceeded, in which case the reverse thrust lever will return to the forward thrust position.

questions.question: A big fan engine gets reverse thrust by:
options: a. reversing the direction of rotation of the compressor.
b. deflecting the exhaust gases.
c. blocking the bypass air.
d. reversing the hot stream gases.

questions.question: Before reverse thrust can be selected, the forward thrust lever must be:
options: a. pulled back to idle power.
b. positioned to reverse minimum power.
c. put back to the reverser deploy position.
d. positioned to reverse maximum power.

questions.question: An aircraft uses clamshell doors for thrust reversal to:
options: a. direct the gas flow rearwards.
b. block the flow of exhaust gas.
c. absorb any change in thrust.
d. change the direction of the exhaust gas.

questions.question: A reverse thrust warning light illuminates:
options: a. only when the reverser doors are fully deployed in the reverse thrust position.
b. when the reverser doors are stowed in the forward thrust position.
c. when the reverser doors are not stowed in the forward thrust position.
d. whenever reverse thrust is selected.

questions.question: Once the blocker doors are fully deployed, with an increase in rpm, which of the following statements would be incorrect?
options: a. Forward thrust from the hot gases would increase.
b. Forward thrust from the hot gases would decrease.
c. Reverse thrust from the blocked air would increase.
d. TGT will increase.
